creator: rlewisshell@mac.com
text:
The websphere nested element of ejbjar does not appear to work with WebSphere 
5.  (If it does in fact work, it does not work as advertised in the docs, in 
which case, this becomes a documentation bug)

The reason appears to be because the v5 ejbdeploy tool requires ws.ext.dirs to 
be set (to most of what was previously set in the <wasclasspath> element).  I 
have modified WebsphereDeploymentTool to verify this (ie. allow setting 
ws.ext.dirs in the nested element), and it works.  Am willing/hoping to share 
the code ... but not sure how.
Just attach patch to this bug report using the "Create a new atatchment" link above. We prefer patches to be formed as unified diffs (diff -u) but if you can't do that, do whatever you can.
creator: conor@apache.org
rlewisshell@mac.com
text:
Created attachment 5481
diff (-u) to add ws.ext.dirs env var (from nested wasextdirs path element) for WebsphereDeploymentTool.java (diff against 1.5.2 version)

creator: nathanr@nathanr.net
text:
Just a success report - I can confirm that Ant 1.6.1 with this patch applied (by
hand, because it didn't apply cleanly for me) deploys my EJBs fine with WSAD 5.1.
